posts.name:
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
posts.content:
Avtar, an organisation which works for diversity and inclusivity in the workplace conducted surveys of 1500 women in each 120 cities. 

The study is mostly based on secondary research and is based on two scores - Social Inclusion Score (SIS) and Industry Inclusion Score (IIS).

Factors where Chennai fell behind Bengaluru include skilling and employment and caregiving support. Chennai stayed ahead in terms of infrastructure and quality of life.

Via

posts.name:
Minakshi G.
Minakshi G.
posts.content:
A man living peacefully with a family of cheetahs—sounds unreal, doesn’t it? 

But It’s amazing how wild animals and humans can coexist when there’s
,
,
, and
.

Interestingly, these same
are the foundation of a
and
.




The cheetahs trust the man because he respects their boundaries and understands their needs. Similarly, in the workplace, trust is built when leaders and colleagues honor commitments, listen actively, and create a safe environment for everyone to thrive.


Ask yourself: Are you fostering a space where your team feels secure and valued?




The man’s kind actions make the cheetahs feel safe. In the workplace, simple acts of kindness—like appreciating someone’s efforts or lending a hand—can create a positive and supportive environment.

Remember: A kind gesture often leads to stronger, more productive relationships.



The man understands the cheetahs’ needs and works with them. At work, understanding your colleagues’ perspectives can help resolve conflicts and build stronger relationships.

Tip: Start by listening without judgment during team discussions or conflicts.



The bond between the man and the cheetahs thrives because of respect. In the office, respecting everyone’s role and contributions leads to better teamwork and a happier workplace.

Insight: Respect isn’t just about hierarchy, it’s about valuing everyone’s contributions equally.



This video of a man living with cheetahs is a testament to what’s possible when we prioritize trust, empathy, kindness, and respect. Whether in nature or the workplace, these values are timeless and universal.

Let’s draw inspiration from this extraordinary bond and strive to create a corporate culture where even the wildest of ideas, personalities, and differences can coexist beautifully.

How are you fostering trust and empathy in your workplace? Share your thoughts!
